item.title: Top and bottom at Christmas - what does it mean?
item.description: As we approach the halfway point of the season, what do the ghosts of Christmas past tell us about the Premier League title race and relegation battle?

item.title: Kings or kingmakers? Villa entering decisive run
item.description: Aston Villa have won nine straight matches to emerge as title contenders despite a poor start to the season. Could 2026 be their year?

item.title: Isak injury in chaotic Liverpool win gives Slot more problems
item.description: Liverpool stretch their unbeaten run to six games but Alexander Isak's injury while scoring overshadows win at Tottenham.

item.title: Romero wouldn't have seen red if referee 'did his job' - Frank
item.description: Cristian Romero would not have been sent off in Tottenham's loss to Liverpool if referee John Brooks "did his job" properly, says Spurs boss Thomas Frank.

item.title: 'Do we want to be remembered for fighting or being cowards?'
item.description: Relegation from the Premier League looks inevitable for Wolves after a 15th defeat in 17 games - but will they avoid setting more unwanted records?

item.title: Were Newcastle denied 'stonewall' penalty against Chelsea?
item.description: Newcastle United manager Eddie Howe says his side were denied a "stonewall" penalty in their 2-2 draw with Chelsea - so, does he have a point?

item.title: Are Hearts, Celtic & Rangers in genuine three-way Scottish title race?
item.description: Heart of Midlothian continue to lead stumbling Celtic as Rangers continue to improve, so how does that leave the Scottish Premiership title race?

item.title: Why is Afcon taking place in December?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why Afcon 2025 is in December and why it is held biannually.

item.title: Liverpool hold on to beat nine-man Spurs
item.description: Substitute Alexander Isak scores for Liverpool before being forced off with injury as Arne Slot's side win a chaotic Premier League match at nine-man Tottenham.

item.title: Gyokores penalty sends Arsenal top of the table in win against Everton
item.description: Arsenal striker Viktor Gyokores' first-half penalty sends the Gunners to the top of the Premier League table in win over Everton.

item.title: Chelsea fight back to claim draw at Newcastle
item.description: Nick Woltemade scores an early double, but Chelsea fight back to claim a 2-2 draw against Newcastle United at St James' Park.

item.title: Calvert-Lewin scores twice as Leeds thrash Crystal Palace
item.description: Dominic Calvert-Lewin extends his scoring streak to five Premier League games with a superb double as Leeds United secure a comfortable victory over Crystal Palace at Elland Road.

item.title: Haaland scores twice as Man City beat West Ham
item.description: Erling Haaland scores twice to help Manchester City beat beleaguered West Ham United for a fifth straight Premier League victory which moved them top of the table.

item.title: Lewis-Potter double piles more misery on Wolves
item.description: Brentford's Keane Lewis-Potter scores twice against Wolves in their 2-0 win at the Molineux.

item.title: Broja heads home late equaliser for Burnley at Bournemouth
item.description: Armando Broja heads home a dramatic late equaliser as struggling Burnley end their seven-game losing streak by claiming a precious Premier League point at Bournemouth.

item.title: Brighton & Sunderland's first ever PL match ends in 0-0 draw
item.description: Brighton's disappointing December run continues as they played out a goalless draw against Sunderland in the Premier League.

item.title: Can Aston Villa sustain a title challenge?
item.description: Football Focus's Alex Scott, Nedum Onuoha and Glenn Murray look at Aston Villa's incredible Premier League form and whether they can sustain a title challenge this season.

item.title: Who are the contenders to win Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport's John Bennett gives Football Focus the lowdown on which nations are contenders to win the Africa Cup of Nations, which begins in Morocco on Sunday.

item.title: Given shares Howe's frustrations on trio of decisions
item.description: Match of the Day's Shay Given shares Newcastle manager Eddie Howe's frustrations after a trio of decisions went against the Magpies in their 2-2 draw with Chelsea.

item.title: Spurs 'lost control' in defeat to Liverpool - Hart
item.description: MOTD Analysis: Ill-discipline cost Tottenham against Liverpool - Joe Hart

item.title: How Man City smothered West Ham with 'suffocating' press
item.description: Match of the Day's Joe Hart looks at Manchester City's "suffocating" press as they looked back to their dominant best in a 3-0 win over West Ham.

item.title: Semenyo prefers Liverpool move - Sunday's gossip
item.description: Antoine Semenyo favours move to Liverpool, Bayern Munich ready with offer for Bruno Fernandes, Chelsea looking for buyers for Nicolas Jackson, plus more.

item.title: Maresca hints at wanting older heads at end of chaotic week
item.description: Blues manager Enzo Maresca hints that having some more experience in his squad would be beneficial following their comeback to earn a point at Newcastle.

item.title: Man Utd 'could make January signing' amid Neves link
item.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim says it is possible the club could make a January transfer window signing.

item.title: Afcon to be held every four years from 2028
item.description: In a huge change to the football calendar, the Africa Cup of Nations will be held every four years from 2028 - switching away from biennial finals.

item.title: What does player v fan argument say about Kilmarnock situation?
item.description: Angry scenes between full-back Dominic Thompson and a group of fans highlighted the increasing tension and concern consuming Kilmarnock.

item.title: Amorim attacks 'feeling of entitlement' at Man Utd
item.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim condemns the "sense of entitlement" at the club and says players should use criticism as fuel to prove him wrong.

item.title: 'Most attacking keeper in league' - why Raya is key for Arsenal
item.description: David Raya has been described as the most attacking goalkeeper in the league by Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta. BBC Sport analyse the importance of the Spaniard.

item.title: Will Afcon 2025 be a defining moment for Morocco?
item.description: Morocco has spent more than a decade reshaping its football, but will hosting Afcon 2025 allow the country to end a 50-year wait for the trophy?

item.title: Gyokeres taking penalty was a surprise to me - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says he was surprised to see Viktor Gyokeres step up to take his team's penalty in the 1-0 win at Everton and says the decision was made by the players.

item.title: O'Brien shouldn't have raised arms for penalty - Moyes
item.description: Everton manager David Moyes says he has "no complaints" about the penalty which gave Arsenal a 1-0 win, after the ball hit Jake O'Brien's raised arms in the box.

item.title: Slot delighted with 'unbelievable' win against nine-man Spurs
item.description: Arne Slot says Liverpool were fortunate to win their "unbelievable" match against nine-man Tottenham.

item.title: Frank proud of players 'unbelievable mentality' in defeat against Liverpool
item.description: Tottenham boss Thomas Frank is proud of his players "unbelievable mentality" as nine-man Spurs nearly earned a draw at home to Liverpool.

item.title: Late Broja goal eases 'massive pressure' on struggling Burnley - Parker
item.description: Burnley manager Scott Parker praises his side for overcoming "massive pressure" in their 1-1 draw against Bournemouth.

item.title: Inside crisis club Wolves - angst, protests & transfer mistakes
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at why Wolves fans have been protesting with Taiwan flags and other banners at matches.

item.title: Mancini, sibling rivalry and wanting to excite fans - the Yaya Toure story
item.description: Yaya Toure reflects on a glittering career at clubs such as Barcelona and Manchester City as well as with his country, Ivory Coast.

item.title: Fifa owes fans thousands for resold World Cup tickets
item.description: Customers who resold World Cup tickets on Fifa’s official platform say they are still waiting for thousands of pounds in payments.

item.title: Man City 'must prepare' for successor, says Guardiola
item.description: Pep Guardiola says Man City "must be prepared" to plan for his eventual departure, after Enzo Maresca says reports suggesting he could succeed the Spaniard are "100% speculation".

item.title: Burnley late equaliser a 'big punishment' for Bournemouth – Iraola
item.description: Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola says his side suffered a "big punishment" in their 1-1 draw against Burnley.

item.title: Guardiola happy Man City challenging on all fronts
item.description: Man City boss Pep Guardiola is pleased with the intensity of the pressing of his forward players and his defence as well after his side comfortably beat West Ham 3-0 at the Etihad Stadium.

item.title: Fatigue not an excuse for defeat - Glasner
item.description: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner says his side cannot use fatigue as an excuse after they fell to a 4-1 defeat against Leeds United at Elland Road.

item.title: Howe 'devastated' with Newcastle United draw
item.description: Newcastle United manager Eddie Howe says he is "devastated" that his side did not win against Chelsea, after a dominant first-half performance.

item.title: Leeds delivered 'top class' football against Crystal Palace - Farke
item.description: Leeds United manager Daniel Farke praises his side's performance after they comfortably beat "difficult and dangerous" Crystal Palace 4-1 at Elland Road.

item.title: Afcon quiz: Name every Africa Cup of Nations winner
item.description: With the Africa Cup of Nations kicking off on Sunday, 21 December, can you name every tournament winner?

item.title: Four players banned for match-fixing offences in A-League
item.description: Four players are banned from ⁠all ⁠football-related activity for several years for their part in match-fixing offences in the A-League.

item.title: Worst start in Old Firm history - how does Celtic manager Nancy compare?
item.description: Wilfried Nancy is the first Old Firm boss to lose his opening four matches - can he recover Celtic's season and survive?

item.title: Spain to face Argentina in Finalissima - but what is it?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when and where the 2026 Finalissima is.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v Zambian rapper Sampa the Great
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Zambian rapper Sampa the Great - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Conceding early made things really hard - Nuno
item.description: West Ham boss Nuno Espirito Santo admits his side made things "really hard" for themselves after conceding an early goal in their 3-0 defeat against Manchester City at the Etihad Stadium.

item.title: Andrews happy for 'patient' Lewis-Potter
item.description: Brentford manager Keith Andrews is pleased to see Keane Lewis-Potter score both goals in a 2-0 win at struggling Wolves.

item.title: Toure 'delighted' to prove doubters wrong
item.description: Yaya Toure says his motives were scrutinised when he joined Man City, leaving him determined to prove the sceptics wrong.

item.title: Dortmund beat Monchengladbach to move up to second
item.description: Borussia Dortmund move up to second in the Bundesliga with a 2-0 win against Borussia Monchengladbach.

item.title: 'Majestic strike' - Mead and Park feature in UWCL best goals
item.description: Strikes from Beth Mead and Jess Park feature in the best goals from this week's Uefa Women's Champions League.

item.title: England's X-factor has 'hill to climb' - will Palmer go to World Cup?
item.description: Does Cole Palmer still have hope of making England's World Cup squad? BBC Sport chief football writer Phil McNulty examines the Chelsea star's chances.

item.title: Best player? Surprise package? Review of WSL so far
item.description: Former England internationals Ellen White and Fara Williams review the Women's Super League season so far as we head into a winter break.

item.title: 'Questions pile up at Celtic, but only some are for Nancy'
item.description: At this point, it's not just Wilfried Nancy's Celtic team that's a hard watch, it's Nancy himself, writes Tom English.

item.title: Inside Wales HQ: Bellamy's tactical masterclass
item.description: Craig Bellamy gives an insight into life as Wales head coach as he sits down with BBC Sport Wales' Feast of Football podcast.

item.title: Six players to watch at Afcon 2025
item.description: BBC Sport Africa picks out six players to keep an eye on at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco from 21 December to 18 January.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why is there only one Premier League game on Sunday?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why there is just one Premier League match on Sunday this weekend

item.title: Unlucky to miss out? Who makes the alternative World XI?
item.description: The Fifa Best Men's XI was announced on Tuesday in Qatar, but who was unfortunate to miss out? BBC Sport takes a look at an alternative World XI.

item.title: Why have footballers started their own YouTube channels?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why football players have started their own YouTube channels.

item.title: Why are the queues to enter Anfield growing?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why Liverpool fans have been asked to arrive at Anfield 10 minutes earlier than usual.

item.title: Why Newcastle and Sunderland don't have away fans pitchside
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Premier League sides Newcastle and Sunderland are permitted to place away fans away from pitchside.

item.title: Which Premier League teams will lose most players to Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport has a look at which Premier League clubs will be most - and least - affected by the Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: Hearts ready to handle pressure, says Shankland - gossip
item.description: Captain backs Hearts to handle pressure, Aberdeen expecting "best" Celtic and Saints boss feeling festive.

item.title: Lewandowski in Chicago Fire talks over MLS move
item.description: Chicago Fire are in pole position to sign Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski in the summer on a free transfer.

item.title: Scotland's Burke scores stunner as Union beat RB Leipzig
item.description: Oliver Burke scores the opener as Union Berlin get the better of second-placed RB Leipzig with a surprise 3-1 victory in the Bundesliga.

item.title: Vardy is first English Serie A player of the month
item.description: Cremonese striker Jamie Vardy is the Serie A player of the month for November, becoming the first English player to win the award.

item.title: Uefa pays £7.9m to clubs for Women's Euros players
item.description: Uefa distributes 9m euros (£7.9m) between 103 European clubs as benefit payments for releasing players for Women's Euro 2025.

item.title: Karen Carney becomes first footballer to win Strictly
item.description: The winner of this year's contest is announced as Claudia Winkleman and Tess Daly host the final for the last time.

item.title: Agyemang is Young Sports Personality of the Year
item.description: England forward Michelle Agyemang is named BBC Young Sports Personality of the Year 2025.

item.title: England boss Wiegman named Coach of the Year
item.description: England women's manager Sarina Wiegman is named the BBC Sports Personality Coach of the Year for a second time.

item.title: Best player? Favourite to win WSL? Emma Sanders Q&A
item.description: As women's domestic and European football takes a pause for the winter break, we asked football fans on Reddit for their questions for BBC Sport reporter Emma Sanders.

item.title: West Ham sack Skinner after one win in 11 games
item.description: West Ham sack head coach Rehanne Skinner after winning only one of their opening 11 Women's Super League games this season.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
